A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependencies.description: PyZMQ: Python bindings for zeromq.

dependencies.description: Run-time type checker for Python

dependencies.name: py-typing-extensions
dependencies.description:
The typing_extensions module contains both backports of these changes as
well as experimental types that will eventually be added to the typing
module, such as Protocol (see PEP 544 for details about protocols and
static duck typing).

dependencies.description: Globus SDK for Python

dependencies.name: py-paramiko

dependencies.name: py-psutil
dependencies.description:
psutil is a cross-platform library for retrieving information on running
processes and system utilization (CPU, memory, disks, network) in
Python.

dependencies.name: py-sqlalchemy
dependencies.description: The Python SQL Toolkit and Object Relational Mapper

dependencies.name: py-sqlalchemy-utils
dependencies.description: Various utility functions and custom data types for SQLAlchemy.

dependencies.name: py-pydot
dependencies.description: Python interface to Graphviz's Dot language

dependencies.name: py-networkx
dependencies.description:
NetworkX is a Python package for the creation, manipulation, and study
of the structure, dynamics, and functions of complex networks.

dependencies.name: py-flask
dependencies.description: A simple framework for building complex web applications.

dependencies.name: py-flask-sqlalchemy
dependencies.description: Add SQLAlchemy support to your Flask application.

dependencies.name: py-pandas
dependencies.description:
pandas is a fast, powerful, flexible and easy to use open source data
analysis and manipulation tool, built on top of the Python programming
language.

dependencies.name: py-plotly
dependencies.description: An interactive, browser-based graphing library for Python

dependencies.name: py-python-daemon
dependencies.description:
Library to implement a well-behaved Unix daemon process. This library
implements the well-behaved daemon specification of PEP Standard daemon
process. A well-behaved Unix daemon process is tricky to get right, but
the required steps are much the same for every daemon program. A
DaemonContext instance holds the behaviour and configured process
environment for the program; use the instance as a context manager to
enter a daemon state.

dependent_to.description: Virtual package for the Exaworks SDK packages.
